instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message:
So this came in with corroded lvds pin, pin 5, 37 and 38 and 40 blown away, but its okay right? Because pin 39 is still there. At first, there's image but no backlight, i tried to change <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> a few times but suddenly there's no display anymore, but macbook still turn on, connect to external video is working fine, so looks like not an gpu issue
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> is 0v
<SIGNAL>LCD_POWER_EN</SIGNAL> 0v
I got 12.6 on both side of F7700
Pin 2 3 4 7 of lvds connector is 3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message:
Did you change LCD connector?
Also check if video cable has good connector.
Be sure to rebuild any broken trace.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message:
Yeah i change lcd connector, the only relevant pad is pin number 38 and 40, but can I just make a solder bridge there?
Anyway the problem now is no image..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message:
Do you mean traces for pads 38/40 on the board, or the pads of video cable?

Check continuity for L9000/10/11.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message:
traces 38 39 40 is gone now, so i jump from <CAPACITOR>C9000</CAPACITOR> to there..
continuity is good on L9000/10/11 , no o.L
I solder <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> , so I can bypass if gmux is the problem.., when i press <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>, I have backlight, but still no image, but i will clean up the backlight problem once i have image later..
i notice the ddc data line <RESISTOR>R0910</RESISTOR> and 0911 is 4.5k, should be 100k ,but when I solder known good 100k resistor, the value will become 4.5k again..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message: for info, i use 15 2011 style lvds connector ( the golden ones )  to this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ( 15" 2012 ), and I use 15 2011 LCD there, because I don't have 15 2012 lcd , I have tried resetting pram everytime im testing.. sometimes I will have image, if image is present, backlight is usually present without me putting pressure on <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message:
I cannot locate <RESISTOR>R0910</RESISTOR>/11 into <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pdf.

Image must come on before backlight.
Do you always have 3V at pins 4/6/7 of J9000?
Be sure to have good contacts on LCD connector; try another LCD assembly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message: sry I mean <RESISTOR>R9010</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R9011</RESISTOR>..i always have 3.3v at pin 4 6 7, i have used known good lcd assembly, and i have tried another..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message:
i don have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> or <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> trying to enable when i plugged in magsafe.. pch?
<RESISTOR>R9010</RESISTOR> and r9011is 67k and 100,5k, so good value, has continuity with the lvds pin

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message:
You should have some corroded traces, or bad contacts.
Be sure J9000 pins have contact with corresponding components.
Image should appear before backlight.
If PCH cannot communicate with display theough CLK/DATA lines, no image, nor backlight possible.
Be aware, all voltages around J9000 must be measured with LCD assembly connected.
